Content:
Running 14 gauge accessory wires today I used landscape drip-line tubing as a housing/casing.
It fit perfectly enough that 6-foot lengths fed through easily but snug.
That landscape drip tube is pretty tough stuff (enough to prevent a wire from getting pinched or abraded) and with the fit it gives a much cleaner install than corrugated shell stuff or a rubber sleeve like OEM.
On the bike you can see the plastic drip line tubing running from the rear up to the front, housing power wires.
